page.title: 11Bowthorpe
page.content:
Bowthorpe is a large new housing development being built to the south of the A47 road, opposite New Costessey.
It was a village at the time of the original Domesday survey. Bowthorpe comes from Boi's Thorp, meaning Boi's Farm or Village. The village was levelled by the 1500s, only the ruin of the church, St Michaels, being left to show that there had been a village there.
In 1973 Norwich City Council bought a 600 acre site for Â£9\ million. The first 'village' to be developed was Clover Hill, followed by Chapel Break, which is nearing completion......
